Authentic Selves Poetry Open Mic
Artists interested in performing,
fill out this application.
What is Authentic Selves?
Authentic Selves is a poetry open mic show. Its unofficial pilot was held February 2022. It was officially launched in March 2022. The event is hosted by Lauren White. Authentic Selves aims to be a community safe space where participants can feel comfortable performing whether they be seasoned artists or are performing for the first time.
When is Authentic Selves held?
Authentic Selves is the third Sunday of every month from 7:30-9:00pm. (With the exception of July, when Timucua is closed.) Doors open at 7:00pm.
Where can I find event information?
Tickets are pay-what-you-like donations.
Please â€œpurchaseâ€ tickets in advance
or donate at the door.
How much do tickets cost?
Tickets are pay-what-you-like donations. Please â€œpurchaseâ€ tickets in advance or donate at the door.
Where do I get tickets?
Tickets are available through Timucuaâ€™s Eventbrite page here.
I cannot attend in person; is there a livestream?
Yes, the show is livestreamed on Timucuaâ€™s YouTube channel. The stream will start approximately 15 minutes before the show and be synced with advertisements showing in the venue.
What is the format of the show?
The format is generally a 15-20 minute set by a featured artist followed by the open mic portion of the show.
How do I sign up to be the featured artist?
Please contact Lauren White at
[emailÂ protected]
. We will require your name, alias (if applicable), a short biography, a short description of what you will be forming, and a high-resolution photo for marketing purposes. (If you have any suggestions for a feature performer, please let us know!)
How long is the featured artist set?
The featured artist has a 15-20 minute set at the beginning of the show.
How do I sign up to participate in the open mic portion of the show?
Fill out the application here.
Please include your first and last name so that we may credit you in the video recording. If you wish, an alias can be provided, too. The form will also ask for a contact email, a short description of what you will be performing, and your consent to be recorded. If you do not sign up in advance, you will be added to the end of the list and may be able to perform if time allows.
How long is an open mic spot?
Five minutes. Note: We will not be timing you; this is on the honor system. We simply ask that you prepare in advance and be courteous. We want as many performers as possible!
Is there a deadline for signing up for the open mic?
Yes, the form must be completed by midnight the Saturday before the show.
Is signing up a guarantee that I will perform?
Due to limited time, there is no guarantee that you will be able to perform, but you can still attend!
I signed up for the open mic, but can no longer attend. What should I do?
Notify our host Lauren White at
[emailÂ protected]
What format can I perform in?
Authentic Selves is focused on the literary arts â€“ one can do poetry, spoken word, stories, songs, or any other content that is spoken and/or lyrical. This does not include simply playing music. Instruments that accompany the lyrical content are allowed.
What content can be performed?
The goal is sharing our authentic selves; all topics are welcome! Note that this may include mature content, profanity, or wording that may not be suitable for children. Some topics may also be triggering for audience members. If you become uncomfortable, please reach out to one of the staff or volunteers so that we can assist you. (Note: While all content is welcome, we prefer not to have overly pornographic content.)
Do I have to perform original content?
Original content is strongly encouraged. If doing a reading or a cover, please cite the content have it adequately prepared.
Does the performance have to be in English?
No! You may perform in any language desired. Translations are encouraged but not required.
Can I include musical tracks in my performance?
The featured artists may include musical tracks. Please let us know in advance to facilitate testing and sound checks.
What is the proper audience etiquette and participation?
We want the audience to be involved. It adds to the energy of the event! You may snap, applaud, etc in a courteous manner. Please do not be so loud as to drown out the performance or distract from the experience of other guests. Anyone exhibiting discourteous behavior will be asked to leave.
We also ask that you silence your cell phones and turn off Bluetooth devices to prevent audio interference. Pictures and video can be taken; please turn off flash and be mindful you are not obstructing the view of others around you.
What equipment is provided?
If needed, there is a music stand and stool.
There is a microphone on the stage that is not to be touched. The acoustic qualities of the venue will capture the sound when you are near the mic. Anyone who grabs or damages the microphone or other equipment will be asked to leave.
Can I bring my own equipment?
The venue does not support outside equipment. Due to the acoustic qualities of the venue, amplifiers or plug-ins are not needed.
Iâ€™m part of a group that wants to collaborate with the show â€“ how do I do that?
Contact Lauren White at
[emailÂ protected]
to schedule an initial discussion. We will require a short description of your group and a copy of your logo (if applicable) for marketing purposes.
Is Authentic Selves advertised on social media?
Yes, event details are shared on
Facebook
and
Instagram
approximately one week before the show.
Can I share content from the show on social media?
Please do! Please tag Timucua Arts (@timucuaarts), staff and volunteers, and other performers.
How do I view a recording of the show?
Recordings will be posted to Timucuaâ€™s
YouTube channel
within a week after the show. Links will be sent to the artists via email or direct message.
How do I apply to perform?
Artists interested in performing,
fill out this application.
I cannot attend in person; is there a livestream?
Yes, the show is livestreamed on Timucuaâ€™s YouTube channel. The stream will start approximately 15 minutes before the show and be synced with advertisements showing in the venue.
Edit: Link to our YouTube channel page.
What if I had other questions?
Please send your questions to:
Lauren White, Host:
[emailÂ protected]

Authentic Selves Poetry Open Mic
Artists interested in performing,
fill out this application.
What is Authentic Selves?
Authentic Selves is a poetry open mic show. Its unofficial pilot was held February 2022. It was officially launched in March 2022. The event is hosted by Lauren White. Authentic Selves aims to be a community safe space where participants can feel comfortable performing whether they be seasoned artists or are performing for the first time.
When is Authentic Selves held?
Authentic Selves is the third Sunday of every month from 7:30-9:00pm. (With the exception of July, when Timucua is closed.) Doors open at 7:00pm.
Where can I find event information?
Tickets are pay-what-you-like donations.
Please â€œpurchaseâ€ tickets in advance
or donate at the door.
How much do tickets cost?
Tickets are pay-what-you-like donations. Please â€œpurchaseâ€ tickets in advance or donate at the door.
Where do I get tickets?
Tickets are available through Timucuaâ€™s Eventbrite page here.
I cannot attend in person; is there a livestream?
Yes, the show is livestreamed on Timucuaâ€™s YouTube channel. The stream will start approximately 15 minutes before the show and be synced with advertisements showing in the venue.
What is the format of the show?
The format is generally a 15-20 minute set by a featured artist followed by the open mic portion of the show.
How do I sign up to be the featured artist?
Please contact Lauren White at
[emailÂ protected]
. We will require your name, alias (if applicable), a short biography, a short description of what you will be forming, and a high-resolution photo for marketing purposes. (If you have any suggestions for a feature performer, please let us know!)
How long is the featured artist set?
The featured artist has a 15-20 minute set at the beginning of the show.
How do I sign up to participate in the open mic portion of the show?
Fill out the application here.
Please include your first and last name so that we may credit you in the video recording. If you wish, an alias can be provided, too. The form will also ask for a contact email, a short description of what you will be performing, and your consent to be recorded. If you do not sign up in advance, you will be added to the end of the list and may be able to perform if time allows.
How long is an open mic spot?
Five minutes. Note: We will not be timing you; this is on the honor system. We simply ask that you prepare in advance and be courteous. We want as many performers as possible!
Is there a deadline for signing up for the open mic?
Yes, the form must be completed by midnight the Saturday before the show.
Is signing up a guarantee that I will perform?
Due to limited time, there is no guarantee that you will be able to perform, but you can still attend!
I signed up for the open mic, but can no longer attend. What should I do?
Notify our host Lauren White at
[emailÂ protected]
What format can I perform in?
Authentic Selves is focused on the literary arts â€“ one can do poetry, spoken word, stories, songs, or any other content that is spoken and/or lyrical. This does not include simply playing music. Instruments that accompany the lyrical content are allowed.
What content can be performed?
The goal is sharing our authentic selves; all topics are welcome! Note that this may include mature content, profanity, or wording that may not be suitable for children. Some topics may also be triggering for audience members. If you become uncomfortable, please reach out to one of the staff or volunteers so that we can assist you. (Note: While all content is welcome, we prefer not to have overly pornographic content.)
Do I have to perform original content?
Original content is strongly encouraged. If doing a reading or a cover, please cite the content have it adequately prepared.
Does the performance have to be in English?
No! You may perform in any language desired. Translations are encouraged but not required.
Can I include musical tracks in my performance?
The featured artists may include musical tracks. Please let us know in advance to facilitate testing and sound checks.
What is the proper audience etiquette and participation?
We want the audience to be involved. It adds to the energy of the event! You may snap, applaud, etc in a courteous manner. Please do not be so loud as to drown out the performance or distract from the experience of other guests. Anyone exhibiting discourteous behavior will be asked to leave.
We also ask that you silence your cell phones and turn off Bluetooth devices to prevent audio interference. Pictures and video can be taken; please turn off flash and be mindful you are not obstructing the view of others around you.
What equipment is provided?
If needed, there is a music stand and stool.
There is a microphone on the stage that is not to be touched. The acoustic qualities of the venue will capture the sound when you are near the mic. Anyone who grabs or damages the microphone or other equipment will be asked to leave.
Can I bring my own equipment?
The venue does not support outside equipment. Due to the acoustic qualities of the venue, amplifiers or plug-ins are not needed.
Iâ€™m part of a group that wants to collaborate with the show â€“ how do I do that?
Contact Lauren White at
[emailÂ protected]
to schedule an initial discussion. We will require a short description of your group and a copy of your logo (if applicable) for marketing purposes.
Is Authentic Selves advertised on social media?
Yes, event details are shared on
Facebook
and
Instagram
approximately one week before the show.
Can I share content from the show on social media?
Please do! Please tag Timucua Arts (@timucuaarts), staff and volunteers, and other performers.
How do I view a recording of the show?
Recordings will be posted to Timucuaâ€™s
YouTube channel
within a week after the show. Links will be sent to the artists via email or direct message.
How do I apply to perform?

fill out this application.

Yes, the show is livestreamed on Timucuaâ€™s YouTube channel. The stream will start approximately 15 minutes before the show and be synced with advertisements showing in the venue.

What if I had other questions?
Please send your questions to:
Lauren White, Host:
[emailÂ protected]

Authentic Selves Poetry Open Mic
Artists interested in performing,
fill out this application.
What is Authentic Selves?
Authentic Selves is a poetry open mic show. Its unofficial pilot was held February 2022. It was officially launched in March 2022. The event is hosted by Lauren White. Authentic Selves aims to be a community safe space where participants can feel comfortable performing whether they be seasoned artists or are performing for the first time.
When is Authentic Selves held?
Authentic Selves is the third Sunday of every month from 7:30-9:00pm. (With the exception of July, when Timucua is closed.) Doors open at 7:00pm.
Where can I find event information?
Tickets are pay-what-you-like donations.
Please â€œpurchaseâ€ tickets in advance
or donate at the door.
How much do tickets cost?
Tickets are pay-what-you-like donations. Please â€œpurchaseâ€ tickets in advance or donate at the door.
Where do I get tickets?
Tickets are available through Timucuaâ€™s Eventbrite page here.
I cannot attend in person; is there a livestream?
Yes, the show is livestreamed on Timucuaâ€™s YouTube channel. The stream will start approximately 15 minutes before the show and be synced with advertisements showing in the venue.
What is the format of the show?
The format is generally a 15-20 minute set by a featured artist followed by the open mic portion of the show.
How do I sign up to be the featured artist?
Please contact Lauren White at
[emailÂ protected]
. We will require your name, alias (if applicable), a short biography, a short description of what you will be forming, and a high-resolution photo for marketing purposes. (If you have any suggestions for a feature performer, please let us know!)
How long is the featured artist set?
The featured artist has a 15-20 minute set at the beginning of the show.
How do I sign up to participate in the open mic portion of the show?
Fill out the application here.
Please include your first and last name so that we may credit you in the video recording. If you wish, an alias can be provided, too. The form will also ask for a contact email, a short description of what you will be performing, and your consent to be recorded. If you do not sign up in advance, you will be added to the end of the list and may be able to perform if time allows.
How long is an open mic spot?
Five minutes. Note: We will not be timing you; this is on the honor system. We simply ask that you prepare in advance and be courteous. We want as many performers as possible!
Is there a deadline for signing up for the open mic?
Yes, the form must be completed by midnight the Saturday before the show.
Is signing up a guarantee that I will perform?
Due to limited time, there is no guarantee that you will be able to perform, but you can still attend!
I signed up for the open mic, but can no longer attend. What should I do?
Notify our host Lauren White at
[emailÂ protected]
What format can I perform in?
Authentic Selves is focused on the literary arts â€“ one can do poetry, spoken word, stories, songs, or any other content that is spoken and/or lyrical. This does not include simply playing music. Instruments that accompany the lyrical content are allowed.
What content can be performed?
The goal is sharing our authentic selves; all topics are welcome! Note that this may include mature content, profanity, or wording that may not be suitable for children. Some topics may also be triggering for audience members. If you become uncomfortable, please reach out to one of the staff or volunteers so that we can assist you. (Note: While all content is welcome, we prefer not to have overly pornographic content.)
Do I have to perform original content?
Original content is strongly encouraged. If doing a reading or a cover, please cite the content have it adequately prepared.
Does the performance have to be in English?
No! You may perform in any language desired. Translations are encouraged but not required.
Can I include musical tracks in my performance?
The featured artists may include musical tracks. Please let us know in advance to facilitate testing and sound checks.
What is the proper audience etiquette and participation?
We want the audience to be involved. It adds to the energy of the event! You may snap, applaud, etc in a courteous manner. Please do not be so loud as to drown out the performance or distract from the experience of other guests. Anyone exhibiting discourteous behavior will be asked to leave.
We also ask that you silence your cell phones and turn off Bluetooth devices to prevent audio interference. Pictures and video can be taken; please turn off flash and be mindful you are not obstructing the view of others around you.
What equipment is provided?
If needed, there is a music stand and stool.
There is a microphone on the stage that is not to be touched. The acoustic qualities of the venue will capture the sound when you are near the mic. Anyone who grabs or damages the microphone or other equipment will be asked to leave.
Can I bring my own equipment?
The venue does not support outside equipment. Due to the acoustic qualities of the venue, amplifiers or plug-ins are not needed.
Iâ€™m part of a group that wants to collaborate with the show â€“ how do I do that?
Contact Lauren White at
[emailÂ protected]
to schedule an initial discussion. We will require a short description of your group and a copy of your logo (if applicable) for marketing purposes.
Is Authentic Selves advertised on social media?
Yes, event details are shared on
Facebook
and
Instagram
approximately one week before the show.
Can I share content from the show on social media?
Please do! Please tag Timucua Arts (@timucuaarts), staff and volunteers, and other performers.
How do I view a recording of the show?
Recordings will be posted to Timucuaâ€™s
YouTube channel
within a week after the show. Links will be sent to the artists via email or direct message.
How do I apply to perform?
Artists interested in performing,
fill out this application.
I cannot attend in person; is there a livestream?

Calling all artists to join us for an evening of artistic expression and community at the Artistsâ€™ Circle. This event is dedicated to empowering artists of all backgrounds and experience levels to showcase their work in a welcoming, relaxed, and fun environment. The goals of this event are to support artists in overcoming imposter syndrome, foster meaningful connections, and provide a safe space where individuals can freely share and celebrate their unique artistic expressions.
We will begin with a short welcoming circle to introduce ourselves to one another and to establish a community within our space. Then, each participant will have 5 minutes to present their work, share their creative process, and discuss their inspirations behind their creations. Audience members are encouraged to engage with the artwork.

ABOUT US
Our mission is to inspire with transformative, world-class performances, education, and artist support in a warm and inviting atmosphere.
Timucua Arts Foundation is a multi-faceted arts and education institution, presenting concerts and festivals and delivering education and wellness programming to people of all ages.
Timucua Arts Foundation presents distinctive integration of the performing and visual arts consistently and affordably, most often presented in the unique
white house
venue.
Our values are rooted in
community
service
,
inclusivity
,
education
,
excellence
, and
sustainability.
Our core belief â€“ The Arts Belong to Everyone â€“ is embodied in an expansive performance schedule unique in Central Florida, encompassing internationally-acclaimed jazz artists, indigenous and folkloric music and dance, contemporary classical music, avant-garde improvisation, film, site-specific theater, and more, all while visual artists work live on stage.

Pay What You Like
Calling all artists to join us for an evening of artistic expression and community at the Artistsâ€™ Circle. This event is dedicated to empowering artists of all backgrounds and experience levels to showcase their work in a welcoming, relaxed, and fun environment. The goals of this event are to support artists in overcoming imposter syndrome, foster meaningful connections, and provide a safe space where individuals can freely share and celebrate their unique artistic expressions.
We will begin with a short welcoming circle to introduce ourselves to one another and to establish a community within our space. Then, each participant will have 5 minutes to present their work, share their creative process, and discuss their inspirations behind their creations. Audience members are encouraged to engage with the artwork.
If youâ€™re interested in showcasing your art, sign up
here
***
NOTE* PLEASE FILL OUT THE FORM 24 HOURS PRIOR TO THE EVENT. Artwork will be showcased on a first-come, first-served basis. Early registration increases your chances of securing a spot to present.
Tickets are available on a pay what you like basis.
Please bring a bottle of wine or non alcoholic beverage to share.
Free parking available on Summerlin and at Wadeview Park.

ABOUT US
Our mission is to inspire with transformative, world-class performances, education, and artist support in a warm and inviting atmosphere.
Timucua Arts Foundation is a multi-faceted arts and education institution, presenting concerts and festivals and delivering education and wellness programming to people of all ages.
Timucua Arts Foundation presents distinctive integration of the performing and visual arts consistently and affordably, most often presented in the unique
white house
venue.
Our values are rooted in
community
service
,
inclusivity
,
education
,
excellence
, and
sustainability.
Our core belief â€“ The Arts Belong to Everyone â€“ is embodied in an expansive performance schedule unique in Central Florida, encompassing internationally-acclaimed jazz artists, indigenous and folkloric music and dance, contemporary classical music, avant-garde improvisation, film, site-specific theater, and more, all while visual artists work live on stage.

About Our Board Members
Terry Olson, President of the Board
Terry Olson brought SAK Theatre to Orlando to perform during the first seven years of Epcotâ€™s existence. Since becoming an Orlandoan he has started numerous arts organizations and performed with more than a dozentheatre, music and dance organization. He spent 23 years creating and growing the Orange County Office of Arts & Cultural Affairs. As a self-proclaimed â€œarts instigatorâ€, he publishes a weekly arts and cultural Update sent to about 10,000 subscribers. Olson
graduated from Bethel University (BA) and University of Minnesota (MA).
Lawrence Haber, Vice
President of the Board
Lawrence Haber is an entertainment attorney with over 40 years of legal experience, including 30 years focused on film, television, and media. He advises on production, distribution, financing, and intellectual property, representing talent, producers, and companies worldwide. A former in-house attorney at Universal Studios Florida and Director of Business Affairs at Walt Disney World, he handled global deals for original TV programming and continues to serve clients across entertainment and digital media.
Maria Dayi, Secretary of the Board
Maria Dayi holds a Bachelorâ€™s in Communications with a focus on Public Relations and Journalism from the University of Puerto Rico. A bilingual (English/Spanish) Claims Liaison specializing in Risk Management, Dayi brings strong leadership experience and a deep commitment to the arts, having served 10 years on the Florida Young Artists Orchestra board and actively supporting organizations like the Timucua Arts Foundation.
Kerrin Kuhn, Treasurer of the Board
For more than 40 years, Kerrin has created change and growth for clients in healthcare, education, entertainment, and other industries. Most recently until her retirement in June 2023, Kerrin served as the Executive Director of the Alzheimerâ€™s & Dementia Resource Center, a local nonprofit providing support and education to caregivers of those living with dementia related illnesses. At Rollins College, she was Prospect Manager and helped increase the yield of their significant gift prospect pool potential by $44 million. As the editor-in-chief at Golden Living, Inc., a national senior healthcare company, she played a crucial role in creating the content and launching six award-winning websites. Kerrin holds a bachelorâ€™s degree in finance from Florida State University.
Jacquelyn Casto
Hi, Iâ€™m Jacquelyn Castoâ€”born and raised in sunny Miami, Florida.
I come from a strong dance and marketing background, and I love bringing energy, creativity, and precision into everything I do.
Whether Iâ€™m choreographing a performance or building a brand, Iâ€™m all about making an impact and connecting with people.
Olivia Share McClanahan, Senior Associate at Nelson Mullins
Olivia focuses her practice on complex commercial litigation, representing clients in an array of commercial fields, including contract and business disputes, trust and probate matters, real property matters, construction disputes, commercial lease disputes and higher education litigation.
Ed Whalley, CFO and COO of Anthros Inc.
Ed Whalley, CFO and COO of Anthros Inc., brings 30+ years of experience in HR and hospitality. He leads financial operations, business development, and strategy, and serves on the FAPEO board. A former executive in golf management and HR outsourcing, Ed is known for driving growth and building strong teams.
Lauren White, Authentic Selves Founder
Lauren, the poetic engineer, is a quirky blend of logic and creativityâ€”a neurotypical engineer, poet, and pop culture enthusiast. Equal parts empathy and intellect, she moves through life with sharp wit, brutal honesty, and a flair for the unexpected.
